Though, it's already blocked because of `/matomo.js$from=~github.com` in both EasyPrivacy and AdGuard Tracking Protection. Not sure if there's a point in adding this.

labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
### ATTENTION

This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you're using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you're using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

comment.body:
It's caused by `Web Annoyances Ultralist`, so please disable it or add this rule:
```adblock
youtube.com#@$##contentContainer.tp-yt-app-drawer[swipe-open].tp-yt-app-drawer::after, tp-yt-app-drawer { position: absolute !important; }
```
to user rules.

### ATTENTION

This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you're using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you're using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

issue.title: www.cloudflare.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.cloudflare.com/ssl/encrypted-sni/#results](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cloudflare.com%2Fssl%2Fencrypted-sni%2F%23results) ### Comment > Encrypted ClientHello в AdGuard не сумісна з vpn режимом Opera. При ввімкненні в додаткових налаштуваннях AdGuard функцію "Використовувати Encrypted ClientHello" в браузері opera, якщо ввімкнути vpn, то ні один сайт не відкривається. При вимиканні Encrypted ClientHello сайти із ввімкненим vpn в opera відображаються нормально, також все працює нормально, якщо навпаки – вимкнути vpn-режим в op[era та ввімкнути Encrypted ClientHello в AdGuard. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/NHke105.png)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://reports-img.adguard.com/wxq7kRd.png)

I'm not sure if it should be blocked.
It looks like some kind of paywall and some options/links do not work if these message is just hidden.

You can try to add these rules:
```adblock
pro.imdb.com#$##logged_out_upsell { display: none !important; }
pro.imdb.com#%#//scriptlet('prevent-addEventListener', 'click', 'event.triggered===')
```
to user rules.

issue.title: meeting.tencent.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://meeting.tencent.com/user-center/shared-record-info?id=8f7e76ea-ba10-4e4e-9736-32d9148f2e84&click_source_for_middle_login=1&app_lang=en-us](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmeeting.tencent.com%2Fuser-center%2Fshared-record-info%3Fid%3D8f7e76ea-ba10-4e4e-9736-32d9148f2e84%26click_source_for_middle_login%3D1%26app_lang%3Den-us) ### Comment Username: @Sulfuric-Acid1024 > 1. The issue here is that a video could not be properly loaded.
> > 2. The URL mentioned could only be accessed using an authorized account, so the developers might not be able to access it directly.
> > 3. The website is ran by Tencent Techology in Chinese, thus some translation might be required for the screenshots to be viewed.
> > 4. The Adblock filtering log has, strangely, recorded nothing being blocked when the problem had first appeared. Further testing, however, has shown the following URL being blocked occationally:
> > https://stats.g.doubleclick.net/j/collect?t=dc&aip=1&_r=3&v=1&_v=j100&tid=UA-205111495-1&cid=1399828849.1671240572&jid=61975550&gjid=784782184&_gid=1611883974.1684501134&_u=QACAAEAAAAAAACAAI~&z=2074651821
> > according to 'AdGuard Base Filter'. This may or may not contribute to the video loading problem.
> > 5. According to the Console page of the Chrome DevTools, the video loading problem always comes with a 403 error with the following URL:
> > https://yunluzhi-az-1258344699.file.myqcloud.com/cos/200000001/1644506350267211776/1644506350267211777/TM-20230408083613-730156640-recording-1.mp4?token=eJxsj01zokAQhv_LXF1kvgeo2oMVlcTC1aAWcS8WAsKIyGT4drP_fSsbk1P6-Lxd3e_zB2y9zThU6tDIGDgAUYoQw5wSgQQkTAjw42MlqmV5BQ5YX8LhLatrVTmmOTTXS3PLpBHeDISZRSjltj0-yUsyLobX6FI28TgqCzMqKxPDj0Em4pQyyAmDmAuMkBD8GybM7dLAEBNIoQUtwhExBIGIcU6hoZOo1LG8pgYaF4q-wXvRKs4PoVL_bb4-3rN6UAlwgD97WPnTp1_uJ5bFO0bcoswmNsefp2QKHKCP7s1s7NdczdOsW6E501t9tpfHSA6pyHY8KPeb82-76PbHicpX3gLPZjHEuq8nQavXff68m-unvlxM03nTvqxRSru9l1UtN5UbLc7PDziG0WQgG4_6JObnxbHv2qVfL4ORt6vacuMH9cvjaTIjQTDKTuyRuTnU3chucnMvsjaZuoXFW2_381486ZXUySE81Ym-i3HE2JdYJutDqsPhPQN__wUAAP__gDmX1w
> > I've compared the request headers to the URL both when AdGuard was on and also when it was off. The only difference I've found was a difference in the Referers:
> > When AdGuard was on:
> > Referer: https://yunluzhi-az-1258344699.file.myqcloud.com/
> > When it was off:
> > Referer: https://meeting.tencent.com/
> > 6. I would suspect the probable cause of the problem was an edit to the referer of the request performed by the AdGuard extension, which, since the request was not blocked, might have not been recorded in the filtering log.
(I have to add
s to the text to show new lines, as they don't seem to be shown in the preview :p) ### Screenshots

issue.title: HTTPS certificate confirmation issues of certain applications.
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android, AdGuard for Windows

### AdGuard version

3.6.11

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers, Website or app doesn't work properly, Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

the problem is with app, not a site

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://tubemate.net

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, EasyList, List-KR

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Hide your search queries, Self-destruction of third-party cookies, Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests, Protect from DPI

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. Symptoms
 When using some application, inform shown below shows and ads won't be blocked or cannot use application at all.

For now, 2 applications majorly that I use is the problem.
1) Tubemate : 
https://tubemate.net
2) SPOTV NOW : 
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=kr.co.spotvnow.app&hl=ko&gl=US&referrer=utm_source%3Dgoogle%26utm_medium%3Dorganic%26utm_term%3Dspotvnow&pcampaignid=APPU_1_VuZrZOySGcOK-Qbgg79o

Especially for the second version, I think this app detects adguard and blocks connection itself when using adguard.

2. Screenshots
<details>
<summary>App does not approve HTTPS certificate</summary>

![Screenshot_20230523-065714_Chrome](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/36753565/6c5c7c75-97c7-4376-854d-6278f3f55330)

</details>


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
Answer to question 2:
From Android 7.0, an Android app does not trust an user TLS certificate by default [^1].
This affects all local VPN-based adblockers including AdGuard or Unicorn Pro adblocker.
So, unless you root your android device, you have to disable HTTPS filtering for app and filters traffic of an app with domain information.

[^1]: https://android-developers.googleblog.com/2016/07/changes-to-trusted-certificate.html

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBlock Origin v1.49.3b19

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed analytics or tracker

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://resumes.breakdownexpress.com/sararaftery, https://resumes.breakdownexpress.com

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, EasyList, EasyPrivacy

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
Possible trackers on this site.
`breakdownexpress.com/js/analytics.js`
`breakdownexpress.com/global/assets/js/logVideoPlay.js` (Maybe?)

On breakdownexpress.com itself:
`breakdownexpress.com/js/ads/googletagPreLoginLeaderboardRect.js`
`breakdownexpress.com/js/ads/googletagLoadAds.js`
`breakdownexpress.com/js/yahoo-dom-event.js` Maybe this one should be /yahoo-dom-event.js
This Yahoo script also appears on http://forum.pj64-emu.com/showthread.php?t=5542
